newsitem.title: NETHERLANDS: European feeds remain slow on strong dollar.
newsitem.headline: European feeds remain slow on strong dollar.

text.p: A stronger dollar kept business on the European meals and feeds market limited to only a few trades this afternoon despite a surge in Chicago soymeal futures, market sources said.

"This morning buyers stayed sidelined on the dollar and in anticipation of a further drop of Chicago futures after Friday's limit-down close. The sudden surge in futures after the opening on fears for frost in Brazil came too late for Europe to spark additional trade," one broker said.
Spot Brazilian soymeal pellets traded at $344/tonne fob and April Argentine sunmeal pellets at $135 cif Rotterdam.--KAREL LUIMES +31 20 504 5832
